result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lauren Elizabeth Schuette

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lauren Elizabeth Schuette appeared by video.  
Attorney Peter John Heflin appeared by video for Lauren Elizabeth Schuette.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
State awaits for Medical Records and upon receipt will provide defense with an Offer.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference.
Court is in trial and ordered case adjourned.
New date confirmed with the State via email and In person with atty Heflin.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lauren Elizabeth Schuette in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense in receipt of  discovery and waiting for an Offer from the State. 
State advises the court she is waiting  on medical records. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lauren Elizabeth Schuette in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense filed a request for substitution of Judge.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Ashley, Br. 19.  Case adjourned for scheduling in Branch 19, Rm 313 SB.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed and forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Lauren Elizabeth Schuette in court with Attorney Peter John Heflin; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: St Francis Sgt. M. Scott. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (6/17/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Lauren Elizabeth Schuette in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lauren Elizabeth Schuette in court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was in court. Attorney Heflin tested postive for Covid. I spoke with Attorney Heflin and we picked out a new court date. Defendant was given a slip with the new court date and time.
